function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Rapid spread of unverified information through social media","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Escalation of social media consumption during lockdowns","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Incorporation of health risk and technological factors in misinformation sharing","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation drivers within the covid-19 context","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of critical thinking and verification of online information leading to sharing of misinformation.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to accurately determine the reliability of news sources.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear and anxiety altering decision-making processes during a pandemic.","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread algorithms","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Confirmation bias and echo-chambers","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of covid-19 media","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Cyberchondria resulting from social media use during covid-19","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fear-driven information-seeking and perception alteration on social media during pandemics","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid spreading of misinformation through social media","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Misinformation fueling health anxiety and impairing health-related decisions","category":"Interactions","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to address new behaviors and values in recovery packages","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inability to shape future outcomes through present actions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure to turn global health crisis into a sustainable opportunity","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rising diversity and inequality within and between countries may lead to different levels of focus on sustainable change, creating a potential divide in disease mitigation efforts.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Failure of fossil fuel-dominated economies to adapt to a sustainable path may lead to instability and conflict, impacting disease management and control efforts.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Geographical diversities and political responses within countries may impact the adoption of sustainable energy transitions, potentially influencing disease prevention efforts.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possibility of a rebound to pre-pandemic ways leading to increased transmission of contagious diseases.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of long-term behavioral and structural change related to fossil fuel demand and air quality.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of political response to warnings of human disaster and resilience in public health and welfare.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Linking covid-19 deaths with air pollution","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rising air pollution as lockdown eases","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift in political focus from short-term gains to long-term resilience measures","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased reliance on cars for transportation due to reduced demand for public transport, leading to higher levels of air pollution and increased risk of accidents.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shift towards working from home and changes in travel patterns leading to long-term reduction in demand for public transport.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Connection between human activity, biodiversity loss, environmental degradation, and health highlighted by the pandemic, leading to increased awareness and urgency for environmental action.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changes in social practices including in mobility and work practices may lead to persistent shifts in transportation behaviors.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reduced high carbon travel has contributed to covid-19 related emissions reductions, but the persistence of reduced travel demand is uncertain.","category":"Structure","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Debates in the public sphere about the ’new normal’ and post-covid-19 world may impact attitudes towards green stimulus and sustainable policies.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global response to covid-19 causing strain on resources and infrastructure","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Changing social and political practices affecting sustainable transitions","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Public support for action on climate change at all-time high prior to covid-19","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of increased decentralization of energy governance from multilateral to national, transnational, and local scales due to the frailty of global cooperation and the impact of covid-19.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of increased government intervention in markets and private life due to the response to the pandemic, leading to potential disruptions in economic and institutional capacities.","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of sufficient policies and regulatory frameworks","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Division within the eu regarding energy transition","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Backtracking of major players on national level commitments","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of coordinated and inclusive global energy governance","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Variability in green stimulus policies across countries","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exacerbated trends towards ’re-shoring’ and localization of energy systems","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Short-term focus on health and livelihoods without considering long-term health and environmental impacts","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on fossil fuels despite evidence of superior economic returns from sustainable initiatives","category":"Society","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate support for cleantech market progress and green energy
